definition: Zhuang ethnic group of Guangxi, the PRC's second most numerous ethnic group
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: He has always had problems putting into words the grandeur of that moment 40 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他一直不太接受40年前的那一刻是庄严壮举的说法。

sentences.english: I mean I was startled by Lin Zexu's exploits.
sentences.chinese: 我是说我被林则徐修渠的壮举给吓了一跳。

sentences.english: After all, she was born into the Georgia bourgeoisie, a milieu rarely thought of as action-packed.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，她生于乔治亚州的中产阶级，能有什么壮举呢？

sentences.english: The Red Army men once wrote down their heroic feat here.
sentences.chinese: 中国工农红军也曾在这里的雪山草地里书写壮举。

sentences.english: It will be an unprecedented occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 这将是史无前例的壮举。

sentences.english: The number of ancestors patriots, fearless express feat legacy remain merit.
sentences.chinese: 多少先辈志士，无畏抒壮举，青史留功绩。

sentences.english: The feat would be both a technological and public relations triumph.
sentences.chinese: 这个壮举将是科技的胜利，也是公共关系的胜利。

sentences.english: The first assent of Mount Everest took place in 1953.
sentences.chinese: 第一宗攀登额菲尔士峰壮举发生于1953年。

sentences.english: Sima Qian visualized this feat as blazing the path into the west regions.
sentences.chinese: 司马迁把这一历史性的壮举形象地描绘为“凿空”。

sentences.english: Then you will see the moon shot.
sentences.chinese: 届时，你会看到那一“奔月”的壮举。

sentences.english: For now, they'll imagine superhuman feats of daring.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他们会幻想那是超人的无畏壮举。

sentences.english: Helping a company work through the process of learning to become Agile is no small feat.
sentences.chinese: 帮助一家公司通过学习变得敏捷是个不小的壮举。

sentences.english: There's a lot of bravura in business about how little people sleep.
sentences.chinese: 关于职场人士牺牲睡眠的壮举有很多，我并不认同。

sentences.english: The first people who found Huahua's feat is Mr.
sentences.chinese: 最早发现花花壮举的是市民黄平汇。

sentences.english: It'seldom happened that a third party ever witnessed any of these prodigies.
sentences.chinese: 这类壮举发生的时候，难得有第三者在场目睹过。

sentences.english: Man's first landing on the moon was a feat of great daring.
sentences.chinese: 人类首次登月是一个勇敢的壮举。

definition: lit. reputation will go down in history (idiom); fig. achievements will earn eternal glory
to see for oneself/to see with one's own eyes
to surpass all others of its kind before and since/to have neither predecessors nor successors
pinyin: qian2 wu2 gu3 ren2 hou4 wu2 lai2 zhe3

definition: deed/past achievement/important event of the past
